intro: Wendlandia acuminata, commonly known as the velvetleaf or cupuaçu tree, is a tropical plant native to the Amazon basin. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant is often found in wet, lowland areas and can grow up to 20 meters tall. Its fruit, which resembles a coconut, contains a sweet, creamy pulp and is used in traditional medicine and as a food source. The plant's botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and economic contexts within its native habitat.
